metadata.title: CVE-2023-5868 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory disclosure vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL that allowsremote users to access sensitive information by exploiting certainaggregate function calls with 'unknown'-type arguments. Handling'unknown'-type values from string literals without type designation candisclose bytes, potentially revealing notable and confidential information.This issue exists due to excessive data output in aggregate function calls,enabling remote users to read some portion of system memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libecpg6 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libpq5 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-15 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-client-15 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-plperl-15 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-15 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-15 - 15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-15 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
